intro: Centaurea novakii, commonly known as the Novak's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers and spiny, bristly foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and grasslands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Centaurea novakii is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it an important component of its native ecosystem.
